refnamediv.refpurpose: A GtkTreeModel which makes an underlying tree model sortable

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Implemented Interfaces
refsect1.para: GtkTreeModelSort implements GtkTreeModel, GtkTreeDragSource and GtkTreeSortable.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkTreeModelSort is a model which implements the GtkTreeSortable interface. It does not hold any data itself, but rather is created with a child model and proxies its data. It has identical column types to this child model, and the changes in the child are propagated. The primary purpose of this model is to provide a way to sort a different model without modifying it.

The use of this is best demonstrated through an example. In the following sample code we create two GtkTreeView widgets each with a view of the same data. As the model is wrapped here by a GtkTreeModelSort, the two GtkTreeViews can each sort their view of the data without affecting the other. By contrast, if we simply put the same model in each widget, then sorting the first would sort the second.

example.title: Using a GtkTreeModelSort

refsect1.para: To demonstrate how to access the underlying child model from the sort model, the next example will be a callback for the GtkTreeSelection "changed" signal. In this callback, we get a string from COLUMN_1 of the model. We then modify the string, find the same selected row on the child model, and change the row there.

example.title: Accessing the child model of in a selection changed callback

refsect2.title: struct GtkTreeModelSort
refsect2.para: This should not be accessed directly. Use the accessor functions below.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_model_sort_new_with_model ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkTreeModel, with child_model as the child_model.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_model_sort_get_model ()
refsect2.para: Returns the model the GtkTreeModelSort is sorting.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_child_path_to_path ()
refsect2.para: Converts child_path to a path relative to tree_model_sort. That is, child_path points to a path in the child model. The returned path will point to the same row in the sorted model. If child_path isn't a valid path on the child model, then NULL is returned.

listitem.simpara: A newly allocated GtkTreePath, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_child_iter_to_iter ()
refsect2.para: Sets sort_iter to point to the row in tree_model_sort that corresponds to the row pointed at by child_iter.

listitem.simpara: A valid GtkTreeIter pointing to a row on the child model

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_path_to_child_path ()
refsect2.para: Converts sorted_path to a path on the child model of tree_model_sort. That is, sorted_path points to a location in tree_model_sort. The returned path will point to the same location in the model not being sorted. If sorted_path does not point to a location in the child model, NULL is returned.

listitem.simpara: A newly allocated GtkTreePath, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_iter_to_child_iter ()
refsect2.para: Sets child_iter to point to the row pointed to by sorted_iter.

listitem.simpara: A valid GtkTreeIter pointing to a row on tree_model_sort.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_model_sort_reset_default_sort_func ()
refsect2.para: This resets the default sort function to be in the 'unsorted' state. That is, it is in the same order as the child model. It will re-sort the model to be in the same order as the child model only if the GtkTreeModelSort is in 'unsorted' state.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_model_sort_clear_cache ()
refsect2.para: This function should almost never be called. It clears the tree_model_sort of any cached iterators that haven't been reffed with gtk_tree_model_ref_node(). This might be useful if the child model being sorted is static (and doesn't change often) and there has been a lot of unreffed access to nodes. As a side effect of this function, all unreffed iters will be invalid.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_model_sort_iter_is_valid ()
refsect2.para: WARNING: This function is slow. Only use it for debugging and/or testing purposes.
Checks if the given iter is a valid iter for this GtkTreeModelSort.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the iter is valid, FALSE if the iter is invalid.

listitem.para: The model for the TreeModelSort to sort.
